      • addUser

        public java.lang.String addUser(UserInterface toAdd)
                         throws InvalidUserException
        Adds a User to the database
        Parameters:
        toAdd - User to add
        Returns:
        String if successful
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if toAdd is null, or if username already exists in database

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getUsers

        public java.util.List<UserInterface> getUsers(Token token)
                                       throws InvalidTokenException,
                                              InvalidUserException,
                                              InvalidAdministratorException
        Returns all users in the database if token is associated with an admin
        Parameters:
        token - Token of the User with authLevel = 2
        Returns:
        List of User objects
        Throws:
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if token is not a valid Token in the database
        InvalidUserException - Throws if token's user is null
        InvalidAdministratorException - Throws if token's User's authLevel is less than 2

        InvalidUserException - Throws if user is null or

      • updateUserInfo

        public java.lang.String updateUserInfo(UserUpdateWrapper wrap)
                                throws InvalidUserException,
                                       InvalidAdministratorException,
                                       InvalidTokenException,
                                       InvalidListException
        Updates the username, password, and authLevel of a User
        Parameters:
        wrap - See UpdateUserWrapper
        Returns:
        String stating which User was updated, and what was Updated, if anything
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if User trying to update doesn't exist. Throws if User updating to is null Throws if User updating to contains a username that already exists
        InvalidAdministratorException - Throws if User with authLevel = 2 is not valid
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if Token does not correspond to an existing User
        InvalidListException - Throws if List is not in expected format

      • updateUserLocation

                                           InvalidTokenException
        Updates a User's location
        Parameters:
        wrap - See LocationUpdateWrapper
        Returns:
        String stating success or not
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if User trying to update doesn't exist
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if Token did not have an existing or matching authenticator or was expired

                                             InvalidListException

        Parameters:
        wrap - See StatisticUpdateWrapper
        Returns:
        String stating success or not
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if User trying to update doesn't exist
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if Token did not have an existing or matching authenticator or was expired
        InvalidListException - Shouldn't throw if above Exceptions weren't thrown

        public java.lang.String updateUserTargets(java.util.List<Token> tokens)
                                   throws InvalidListException,
                                          InvalidUserException,
                                          InvalidTokenException
        Updates the target of a User
        Parameters:
        tokens - List<Token> that contains the Token of the User to update, and the Tokens of the target to set
        Returns:
        String stating success or not
        Throws:
        InvalidListException - Throws if tokens was not in expected format
        InvalidUserException - Throws if User trying to update does not exist
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if Token did not have an existing or matching authenticator or was expired

        public java.lang.String deleteToken(Token token)
                             throws InvalidTokenException,
                                    InvalidUserException
        Deletes a User's Token based on an inputed Token
        Parameters:
        token - Token to delete
        Returns:
        String stating success or not
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if token's User is null or nonexistent
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if token is null

      • deleteUser

        public java.lang.String deleteUser(Token token)
                            throws InvalidTokenException,
                                   InvalidUserException
        Deletes a User from the database based on an inputed Token
        Parameters:
        token - Token who's User desired to be deleted from database
        Returns:
        String saying if was deleted or not
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - Throws if User associated with token is null or nonexistent
        InvalidTokenException - Throws if token is null
